decision_conditions: It is recommended that this Blue Atlantic Cedar tree T4 as shown on the Havering TPO plan 27/80 can have the main central part of crown by 3 metres branch length and upright reiteration growth by 4 metres branch length reduced. Reduce lateral crown spread by up to 3 metres branch length back to suitable growing points, from the tip to an inter-nodal branch break to leave the tree balanced.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out to the standards detailed in British Standard Document BS 3998:2010.
To ensure that the work is carried out in accordance with good arboricultural practice.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out as an overall reduction, so that the tree's crown remains balanced.
To ensure that the tree's stability is maintained and in the interests of public amenity.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out within 2 years from the date of this consent.
To prevent the accumulation of consents.
description:
1 x Blue Atlantic Cedar - reduce main central part of crown by 3 metres branch length and upright reiteration growth by 4 metres branch length. Reduce lateral crown spread by up to 3 metres branch length back to suitable growing points & remove deadwood. 
The tree does not appear to have been managed for some time, there are a number of large dead branches & a potential decay column into the main trunk from a shed limb wound at 3.5 metres; & the tree has recently shed a large branch. 
Works are required as routine management to reduce branch leverage & sail effect in windy conditions.
